name: Film firsts
description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

key_work.title: Arrival of film
key_work.brief_description: A compilation of different scenes from the beginning of cinema.

start.title: Arrival of film

constellations_primary.name: Film firsts
constellations_primary.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

end.title: Roundhay Garden Scene
end.brief_description: The earliest surviving celluloid film, and believed second moving picture ever created, was shot by Louis Aimé Augustin Le Prince using the LPCCP Type-1 MkII single-lens camera. It was taken in the garden of Oakwood Grange, the Whitley family house in Roundhay, Leeds.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

links.description: Louis Le Prince recorded the first motion pictures like Roundhay Garden Scene using his single-lens camera long before better-known pioneers like Thomas Edison and the Lumière brothers. The French filmmaker’s mysterious disappearance, however, meant that he’s often been overlooked.

start.title: Roundhay Garden Scene
start.brief_description: The earliest surviving celluloid film, and believed second moving picture ever created, was shot by Louis Aimé Augustin Le Prince using the LPCCP Type-1 MkII single-lens camera. It was taken in the garden of Oakwood Grange, the Whitley family house in Roundhay, Leeds.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

end.title: Neptune's Daughter
end.brief_description: The daughter of King Neptune takes on human form to avenge the death of her young sister, who was caught in a fishing net. However, she falls in love with the king, the man she holds responsible.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

constellations_other.name: Ice queens and sirens of the sea
constellations_other.description: Sports stars and mythological creatures on-screen.

links.description: The technology that Le Prince used in Roundhay Garden Scene laid the groundwork for later films like Neptune’s Daughter, which was one of the first feature length films and starred Australian swimmer and actress Annette Kellerman as the title character.

start.title: Neptune's Daughter
start.brief_description: The daughter of King Neptune takes on human form to avenge the death of her young sister, who was caught in a fishing net. However, she falls in love with the king, the man she holds responsible.

constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

constellations_other.name: Ice queens and sirens of the sea
constellations_other.description: Sports stars and mythological creatures on-screen.

end.title: Million Dollar Mermaid
end.brief_description: After overcoming polio, Annette Kellerman achieves fame and creates a scandal when her one-piece bathing suit is considered indecent.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

constellations_other.name: Ice queens and sirens of the sea
constellations_other.description: Sports stars and mythological creatures on-screen.

links.description: Annette Kellerman was also one of the first women to wear a one-piece bathing suit, which she campaigned for publicly. Her life was immortalised in the biopic Million Dollar Mermaid (1952), which followed her quest to swim the English Channel.

start.title: Million Dollar Mermaid
start.brief_description: After overcoming polio, Annette Kellerman achieves fame and creates a scandal when her one-piece bathing suit is considered indecent.

constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

constellations_other.name: Ice queens and sirens of the sea

end.title: Be Natural: The Untold Story of Alice Guy-Blaché
end.creator_credit: Pamela B. Green and Artemis Rising
end.brief_description: The epic life story of Alice Guy-Blaché (1873–1968), a French screenwriter, director and producer, true pioneer of cinema, the first person who made a narrative fiction film; author of hundreds of movies, but banished from history books.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

links.description: Million Dollar Mermaid was called that because Kellerman appeared in the first million-dollar production, A Daughter of the Gods (1916). She was one of many pioneering women in film, like Alice Guy-Blaché, whose story was told in Be Natural: The Untold Story of Alice Guy-Blaché.

start.title: Be Natural: The Untold Story of Alice Guy-Blaché
start.creator_credit: Pamela B. Green and Artemis Rising
start.brief_description: The epic life story of Alice Guy-Blaché (1873–1968), a French screenwriter, director and producer, true pioneer of cinema, the first person who made a narrative fiction film; author of hundreds of movies, but banished from history books.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

end.title: Lumière!
end.brief_description: A collection of restored prints from the Lumière Brothers.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

links.description: Be Natural: The Untold Story of Alice Guy-Blaché shed light on the first recorded female filmmaker, but Alice Guy-Blaché wasn’t the only pioneer to get a documentary, with the Lumière brothers spotlighted in Lumière! (2016).

start.title: Lumière!
start.brief_description: A collection of restored prints from the Lumière Brothers.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

end.title: Léon: The Professional
end.headline_credit: France and United States of America, 1994
end.brief_description: Léon, the top hit man in New York, has earned a rep as an effective “cleaner”. But when his next-door neighbors are wiped out by a loose-cannon DEA agent, he becomes the unwilling custodian of 12-year-old Mathilda.

constellations_other.name: Film firsts
constellations_other.description: The early days of cinema were an exciting period of experimentation, with many inventors racing to come up with their own moving-image devices.

links.description: Lumière! showed how the Lumière brothers understood the potential of the theatrical experience. They worked with Léon Gaumont, who supported his secretary – Alice Guy-Blaché – to make films and had the first production company, Gaumont, which still exists and made Léon: The Professional.
